content.description:
To the right of the arete is a very short face climb. Looked easier then it was, which is why I am adding it. It is truly a one move wonder, if you can manage to get established at all. 

 Start with right hand on a small side-pull crimp and left hand where ever you want, step up to get onto the awkward start stance. Once you are established, make a dead-point move to a good jug towards the top of the arete. It takes a good bit of core tension to hold the jug. This actually ended up being a lot more fun that I thought too.
content.location: to the right of the arete on the blank face

content.description: Sit start with both hands matched on the large jug rail. Fire up left hand to a  good side-pull and top-out straight up and over the bulge.
Start the same as "Norb", except instead of going straight up, traverse the lip to the right and then head up the arete. Easiest to stay left while topping out the arete.
content.location: Same start as "Norb". See beta photo.

content.description: Lots of great problems on this boulder. We scrubbed up a few lines and there is definitely potential for more.
